place.name: CRICKET MALHERBIE
place.gazetteerText: CRICKET-MALHERBIE, a parish in Chard district, Somerset; near the Chard canal, and the line of the Chard and Taunton railway, 3½ miles NE of Chard. It has a post office under Chard. Acres, 540. Real property, £754. Pop., 21. Houses, 5. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £80. Patron, Elizabeth Pitt. The church consists of nave, chancel, aisles, and porch, with tower and spire: contains a brass of the Pitts; and is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
